content:
Domain & Context
Domain: Business/SaaS domain with user account management
User Type: Mobile app users who need to manage their account settings and preferences.
Platform Impact: Mobile users need a concise and intuitive settings page with clear actions and touch-friendly interface.  Limited screen real estate necessitates prioritization of settings.

User Requirements
Primary Goals: Access and modify personal and business account information, manage app preferences (notifications, chats, etc.), securely manage account access (password changes, logout).
Secondary Goals: Understand the meaning of "Verified ID" badge, easily find and use help resources if needed.
User Constraints: Small screen size, touch-only interaction, potential for interruptions, limited attention span.
Ready for handoff if: All settings from the reference image are included, using existing app components, top and bottom navigation bars are implemented, and touch targets meet minimum size requirements.


Content Requirements
Critical: Personal details (editable), Business details (editable), Access to Cars45 auction (toggle), "Verified ID" badge (with explanation), Change phone number, Change email, Change language, Disable chats (toggle), Disable Feedback (toggle), Manage notifications, Change password, Delete my account permanently, Log out.
Supporting:  Help/support links for any setting.
Contextual:  Success/failure messages after saving changes, loading indicators during actions (e.g., password change).


Structural & Component Directives
* Layout: Vertical list of settings, similar to reference image, with top and bottom app navigation bars.  Each setting should be a tappable list item.
* Components: Use existing app components for list items, toggles, and buttons.  Consider using a consistent design for all settings.
* Styling: Adhere to the existing app's color scheme and style guide. Use visual cues for active/inactive toggles.


Screen Requirements
Primary Actions:  Navigate to each settings detail page (for those that require more detail), toggle settings (chats, feedback, Cars45 auction), initiate account deletion, logout.
Secondary Actions: Access help/support for individual settings.
Screen States: Default state, loading state (for actions like saving changes), success/error states (for actions like password changes or account deletion).
Feedback Needs: Clear visual feedback for toggles (on/off), confirmation messages upon successful changes, appropriate error messages for failed actions.
